title: 108_hr3514
content:
The Pennsylvania National Forest Improvement Act of 2004 includes provisions for the disposal and conveyance of various administrative sites within the Allegheny National Forest in Pennsylvania. This Act also addresses the administration of land acquired by the United States and its relation to other conveyance authorities. The Secretary of Agriculture has the authority to convey National Forest System lands and administrative sites in the Allegheny National Forest, Pennsylvania, through sale or exchange. This includes various tracts such as ranger residences and undeveloped sites, as depicted on specific maps. The Secretary of Agriculture can convey National Forest System lands in the Allegheny National Forest, Pennsylvania, including ranger residences and undeveloped sites, as shown on specific maps. The maps serve as the primary descriptions of the lands, and in case of conflict, the map description prevails. Recipients of land can offer other land or improvements as consideration for the conveyance. The Secretary may convey land in the National Forest System, and recipients can offer other land or improvements as consideration. Cash equalization payments exceeding 25% of land value may be accepted. Conveyances are subject to applicable laws and regulations, with a preference for public entities using the land for public purposes. Offers for land conveyance can be solicited with specified terms and conditions. The Secretary may convey land in the National Forest System to public entities for public purposes. Offers for land conveyance can be solicited with specified terms and conditions. Any public order withdrawing the land from appropriation is revoked upon conveyance. Additional terms and conditions may be required to protect the interests of the United States. The Secretary has the authority to convey land in the National Forest System to public entities for public purposes, with specified terms and conditions. Any public order withdrawing the land from appropriation is revoked upon conveyance. Additional terms and conditions may be required to protect the interests of the United States. The Secretary of Agriculture may convey US Tract 770, Sheffield Ranger District Headquarters, consisting of 5.50 acres, to the Warren County Development Association for a lump sum payment of $100,000. The map titled "Allegheny Unit, Elk Tanning Company Tract 770, 1934" serves as the primary description of the lands. Any public order withdrawing the land from appropriation is revoked upon conveyance. The Secretary of Agriculture may convey US Tract 770, Sheffield Ranger District Headquarters, consisting of 5.50 acres, to the Warren County Development Association. Any public order withdrawing the land from appropriation is revoked upon conveyance. The Secretary of Agriculture may convey the Ridgeway Ranger District Headquarters in Elk County, Pennsylvania. The Secretary of Agriculture may convey US Tract 904 and US Tract 905 to Ridgeway Township, Pennsylvania. Ridgeway Township must pay the fair market value for the lands. The maps serve as the primary description of the lands, available for public inspection until disposal. The map is the definitive description of the lands unless it cannot be located. The maps are available for public inspection until the lands are disposed of. Upon conveyance of land by the Secretary, any public order withdrawing the land from appropriation is revoked. SEC. 5. CONVEYANCE OF MARIENVILLE RANGER RESIDENCE, FOREST COUNTY, PENNSYLVANIA. The Secretary of Agriculture may convey, without consideration, to the Marienville Volunteer Fire Department of Forest County, Pennsylvania, all right, title, and interest of the United States in a portion of US Tract 844, Marienville ranger residence. The map titled "Allegheny Unit, Peter B. DeSmet Tract 844, 1936" identifies this portion as Lot 2 on the Survey Plat prepared by D. M. Heller on December 12, 1999. Upon conveyance, any public order withdrawing the land from appropriation under public land laws is revoked. SEC. 6. DISPOSITION OF FUNDS.

The Secretary of Agriculture will deposit proceeds from sales or exchanges under section 2, and consideration received from sections 3(b) and 4(b) into the Sisk Act Fund. These funds will be available for acquiring, constructing, or improving administrative facilities and sites in the Allegheny National Forest, as well as acquiring land and interests in land within the forest. The acquisition of lands using these funds is subject to the condition that the market value may not exceed 125 percent of the market value of the lands disposed of under this Act.

SEC. 7. ADMINISTRATION OF LAND ACQUIRED BY UNITED STATES. SEC. 7. ADMINISTRATION OF LAND ACQUIRED BY UNITED STATES.

Lands acquired by the Secretary of Agriculture under section 6(b) or by exchange under section 2 shall be managed in accordance with the Weeks Act and other laws pertaining to National Forest System lands. The boundaries of the Allegheny National Forest will be adjusted based on land disposal and acquisition under this Act. 

SEC. 8. RELATION TO OTHER CONVEYANCES AUTHORITIES.

Nothing in this Act affects the Secretary of Agriculture's authority to sell, exchange, or acquire land. Lands authorized for disposal under this Act are not subject to certain provisions of title 40, United States Code. Passed by the House of Representatives on October 5, 2004.
